events.name: GDG Bonny Inauguration
events.description:
• What we'll do
Official Inauguration, Keynotes and Introduction To Google Technologies.

• What to bring
Laptop computers, Smart Phones, Power Extensions, Writing Materials.
Operating System: Any OS.

• Important to know

events.name: GDG Bonny Cloud Study Jam18

venue.name: Redeemed Christian of Church Rock of Ages Parish, Teenagers Church

events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?

Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

• What to bring
Bring a laptop (Linux, Windows, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

• Important to know
+ Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.

+ Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.

+ Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).

+ Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what you
know about Cloud computing.

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 GDG Bonny Island
events.description:
It's here again!!!

Google I/O Extended 18

I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

Join us for Codelabs to learn about flutter and build an amazing app, and a chance to talk with Googlers who will be on-hand to share their insights.

+What to bring
+ Bring a laptop (Linux, Windows, Mac or Chromebook)! for the Breakout Session Code Labs.
+ Power Extensions

events.name: Google Next '18 Extextend
events.description:
Next ’18 is our global exhibition of inspiration, innovation, and education. It’s where developers and anyone passionate about an accessible, scalable, socially responsible cloud come together to share challenges, solutions, 10x ideas, and game-changing technologies.

We will have some hands-on "Qwiklabs" on Machine Learning, as well as catching up with some highlights from the conference.

Bring your laptop if you'd like to join in the labs, otherwise you can watch on the main screen. More so, come with power extension.

We will be glad to see you coming with your friends.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time.

Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.

Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Plus amazing refreshment

events.name: Google Assistant (Build Actions For Your Community)
events.description:
Actions on Google let you build for the Google Assistant. Your integrations can help you engage users through Google Home, Android & iOS phones, Wear OS, Android TV, and Smart Displays and more in the future.

We are going to have lot's of codelabs.

There'll be amazing refreshment session.

What To Come With:
+ Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers.

+ Power Extension

+ Friends

events.name: Flutter Live: Viewing Party
events.description:
Join us for Flutter Live on December 5th to experience the latest from Flutter, Google’s free and open source SDK for building high-quality native iOS and Android apps from a single codebase.

Flutter Live is all about our online audience. With viewing parties happening Bonny Island with exclusive content during the main event.

We are optimizing Flutter Live to reach the largest audience of mobile developers and provide all the rigor and excitement of an in-person experience to our global online audience.

You will hear directly from the Flutter team, external partners, and other Googlers with demos, technical content, and updates. Wherever you are, there will be a chance to engage with the community, ask questions, and share what you have been building with Flutter.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam 19
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: IO Extended '19 Bonny Island
events.description:
Google I/O Extended events are focused on bringing the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions, in real-time. They also offer unique activities targeted to developers, such as hackathons and codelabs.

Join us for Codelabs to learn about amazing app, and a chance to talk with Googlers who will be on-hand to share their insights.

+What to bring
+ Bring a laptop (Linux, Windows, Mac or Chromebook)! for the Breakout Session Code Labs.
+ Power Extensions

events.name: Flutter Study Jam 19 (Day 1)
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.
Want to get started on building Flutter apps?
Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

Agenda:

3:00 PM: Flutter Udacity Course Introduction
3:45 PM: Break
4:00 PM: Building Simple mobile app that generates proposed names for a startup company
6:00 PM: Event ends

events.name: Flutter Study Jam 19 (Day 2)
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.
Want to get started on building Flutter apps?
Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

Agenda:

3:00 PM: Creating beautiful UIs using Material Components and Flutter.
3:45 PM: Break
4:00 PM: Continuation of Creating beautiful UIs using Material Components and Flutter.
6:00 PM: Event ends

events.name: Kotlin Everywhere
events.description:
Kotlin/Everywhere is a series of community-driven events focussing on the potential of Kotlin on all platforms. We are aiming to help learn the essentials and best practices of using Kotlin everywhere, be it for Android, back-end, front-end and other platforms.

Whether you are a developer, a speaker, a Kotlin User Group, a Google Developer Group member or any other community leader join us. Anyone interested in learning Kotlin and its ecosystem, sharing knowledge, and hosting a Kotlin-focused event is welcome to attend.

If you are a developer wanting to learn more about Kotlin, or a speaker excited to share your Kotlin experience with others, you can join us.

What to come with:

+ Your laptop with any Operating System (if you don't have, please don't panic. We have you covered)
+ Make sure you have Android Studio installed or any other supported IDE for Kotlin
+ A power extension
+ Your friends
+ Your Brain
+ Your Writing Materials

events.name: Devfest Bonny Island 2019
events.description:
DevFests are community-led, developer events hosted by GDG chapters around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies. Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community and region that hosts it.

Agenda:

Machine Learning
Flutter
Actions on Google
Firebase
Cloud
PWA
Artificial Intelligence
Android

Flutter

events.description:
Hey, have you heard about Flutter or you wanna know more about it, Join us for a day of creation and collaboration with the world.

With viewing parties around the world, everyone can be a part of this interactive event that focuses on sharing ideas, experimenting and crafting beautiful experiences across devices.

Save the date.

events.name: Firebase Study Jam Bonny Island
events.description:
Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Firebase for Web technologies as a team.

Want to get started building web apps? Learn how to do that with Firebase!
Join us for our Firebase Study Jam! Together we'll work through Firebase for web codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Firebase…..

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of popular browsers.
For the best experience check out Get Started with Firebase for Web.
Don’t forget your charger.
